required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: GORE® VIABAHN® Endoprosthesis Post-Marketing Surveillance Study
clinical_study.official_title: GORE® VIABAHN® Endoprosthesis Post-Marketing Surveillance Study - Treatment of Patients With Stenosis or Occlusion at the Venous Anastomosis of Synthetic Arteriovenous (AV) Access Graft

brief_summary.textblock: This study will confirm the efficacy and safety in the clinical setting after the launch of the GORE® VIABAHN® stent graft (hereafter referred to as "Viabahn") for the treatment of patients with stenosis or occlusion at the venous anastomosis of synthetic arteriovenous access graft.

primary_outcome.description: Primary patency of target lesion is defined as the period during the patency was maintained from initial treatment until occlusion of target lesion or re-treatment of target lesion.
Secondary patency of target lesion is defined as the period during the patency was maintained from initial treatment (including the period of patency after re-treatment).

primary_outcome.measure: Primary Patency of Vascular Access Circuit
primary_outcome.description: Primary patency of vascular access circuit is defined as the period during the patency was maintained from initial treatment until occlusion in vascular access or re-treatment in vascular access circuit.

primary_outcome.measure: Secondary Patency of Vascular Access Circuit
primary_outcome.description: Secondary patency of vascular access circuit is defined as the period during the patency was maintained from initial treatment until discontinuation of the use of vascular access circuit.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Cumulative Number of Re-treatment in Target Lesion
primary_outcome.description: Mean cumulative number of re-treatment in target lesion is defined as the number of re-treatment performed for target lesion after the initial treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Achieving Technical Success
primary_outcome.description: Technical Success is defined as < 30% residual stenosis after initial treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Achieving Clinical Success
primary_outcome.description: Clinical Success is defined as the resumption of normal dialysis for at least one session after the initial treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Experiencing Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is defined as any unfavorable or unintended sign (including abnormal laboratory changes), symptom, or illness associated with the use of a medical device. Unless worsening of severity or increasing of incidence during the surveillance, the primary disease of the patient is not considered an adverse event.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Experiencing Device Defects
primary_outcome.description: A device defect is defined as a defect such as damage, malfunction, etc. that are widely unfavorable. Regardless of whether they are due to design, marketing, distribution, or use.

arm_group.description: Participants will be examined 1, 3, 6, 12 and 24 months following the GORE® VIABAHN® Stent Graft installation.

intervention.description: On Day 1, participants will receive the GORE® VIABAHN® Stent Graft.

study_pop.textblock: patients with stenosis or occlusion at the venous anastomosis of synthetic arteriovenous (AV) access graft in Japan.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants who developed stenosis or occlusion at the venous anastomosis of synthetic arteriovenous access graft
- Participants who was used to repair vascular access circuits for purposes other than treatment of stenosis or occlusion at the venous anastomosis of synthetic arteriovenous access graft

facility.name: Ikeda Vascular Access, Dialysis and Internal Medicine Clinic
